{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3129914,"name":"Jackson Elia","username":"Traptricker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/traptricker/{size}/215403_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T19:06:28.850Z","cooked":"

This year my team wants to use pose estimation with the april tags. The docs leave much to be desired and I was wondering if anyone had an example of the SwerveDrivePoseEstimator class being used. Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-01-19T19:06:28.850Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1893,"reads":459,"readers_count":458,"score":9551.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":423897,"topic_slug":"example-code-for-the-swervedriveposeestimator-class","display_username":"Jackson Elia","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/advanced-controls/state-space/state-space-pose-estimators.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Pose Estimators — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":81}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53032,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4829 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/example-code-for-the-swervedriveposeestimator-class/423897/1","custom_user_title":"4829 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3129952,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T20:06:32.217Z","cooked":"

A student and I did a presentation on using PhotonVision with the SwerveDrivePoseEstimator. It’s on First Updates Now YouTube.

Here’s the latest version of our code, for reference:

github.com

STMARobotics/frc-7028-2023/blob/5916bb426b97f10e17d9dfd5ec6c3b6fda49a7ce/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/PoseEstimatorSubsystem.java

package frc.robot.subsystems;

import static frc.robot.Constants.VisionConstants.CAMERA_TO_ROBOT;

import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.Optional;

import org.photonvision.PhotonCamera;

import edu.wpi.first.apriltag.AprilTagFieldLayout;
import edu.wpi.first.apriltag.AprilTagFieldLayout.OriginPosition;
import edu.wpi.first.apriltag.AprilTagFields;
import edu.wpi.first.math.VecBuilder;
import edu.wpi.first.math.Vector;
import edu.wpi.first.math.estimator.SwerveDrivePoseEstimator;
import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose3d;
import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Transform3d;
import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3;
import edu.wpi.first.math.util.Units;
This file has been truncated. show original

Traptricker:

I was wondering if anyone had an example of the SwerveDrivePoseEstimator class being used

There’s an example project you can instantiate in VS Code via the command pallette:

github.com

//github.com/wpilibsuite/allwpilib/tree/main/wpilibjExamples/src/main/java/edu/wpi/first/wpilibj/examples/swervedriveposeestimator

I realize I’m late to this, but would you recommend using the default standard deviations to start with? Or should we calculate the standard deviation for our vision measurements? I don’t know how we can calculate the standard deviation for our swerve drive, so I assume we should just use the SD in the example

sam.mulvey747:

would you recommend using the default standard deviations to start with?

Yes. That’s why we provide them.

How does this model hold up during a match? Is there a realistic amount of time before the drift accumulates and the pose estimate becomes unusable? Pardon my lack of knowledge of how a Kalman Filter handles drift.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-26T18:44:40.219Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":200,"readers_count":199,"score":59.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":423897,"topic_slug":"example-code-for-the-swervedriveposeestimator-class","display_username":"Sam Mulvey","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":16846,"username":"calcmogul","name":"Tyler Veness","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":35690,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/example-code-for-the-swervedriveposeestimator-class/423897/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3153202,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-26T18:55:51.477Z","cooked":"
sam.mulvey747:

How does this model hold up during a match?

I have no idea. It depends on how accurate your odometry is. The less accurate it is, the more you need to trust your vision measurements and/or the more often you need to use vision measurements to correct.

I have a question, what units should I be measuring my Camera to robot Transform3d value? Should I be measuring in meters?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-03-06T13:52:54.162Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":163,"readers_count":162,"score":82.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":423897,"topic_slug":"example-code-for-the-swervedriveposeestimator-class","display_username":"Ryan zheng","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":44380,"username":"gdefender","name":"Andy Gasser","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55168,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/example-code-for-the-swervedriveposeestimator-class/423897/8","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3158196,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-06T15:03:56.900Z","cooked":"

Yes, I recommend meters. The most important thing is to be consistent with units throughout your code.
